data.title: Awesome donuts!
data.text: I drive 20 minutes to get these donuts.  That says a lot right there.  I live much closer to Leucadia Donuts and VG's.  But these are the old school donuts I remember as a kid.  Go in the morning and you will catch them frosting the donuts right before handing you one.  My daughter loves the chocolate, my husband the white frosted and I waffle between the white and the blueberry.  All delicious and SO fresh.

data.title: Another Nostalgic Place in Vista
data.text: A wonderful donut shop known by all the locals.  They don't seem to ever run out and everything is always super fresh.  The best donuts in town.

data.title: Delicious donuts!
data.text: My Waze app led me to Danny's Donuts this morning. I ordered a half dozen plus a bagel w/cream cheese. Ordering through the glass window proved challenging. I ended up with two plain cake donuts instead of the chocolate cake donuts :( The donuts were great tasting and fresh! The apple fritter was really fresh and tasty.  They only had one type of bagel, sesame, which was good but not what I really wanted. That being said, the donuts and coffee are off the hook! Definitely a gem in downtown Vista, CA. Danny's is worth the drive if you live on the opposite side of Vista, like I do!

data.title: Blueberry old fashioned
data.text: It's been a little while, but the last time I was here I bought 2 dozen to take to the office for everyone. They were a hit! The blueberry old fashioned is my favorite, but all are good.

data.title: Not your usual Donut Shop
data.text: So you think a donut is a donut is a donut?  Not at Danny's Donuts! Whereas the big chains like Winchell's, and Dunkin' spread the same recipes throughout their franchises, Danny's is a locally owned shop, with their own ideas.  They have some specialties, like Blueberry, and Pistachio donuts, that are to die for! They've won contests and acclaim for their innovative taste treats!  And, the construction is finally finished on the streets surrounding their shop, so getting in and out is a breeze.

data.title: donuts~~~
data.text: This is a great Donut shop.  I love cake donuts, & theirs are the best in the area.  The street is under construction at this time, so is a bit hard to get to, but well worth the time.  Very friendly service.

data.title: Yummy Blueberry Donuts & Apple Betty
data.text:
Danny's Donuts are responsible for the best glazed blueberry doughnuts ever! Until we went to Danny's we  had never had a blueberry doughnut before. Mouth-watering just thinking about it now.
And their Apple Betty creation is absolutely delicious. Even my "Mr. Man" found the Apple Betty to be even more "delicious" than his usual apple fritter and raved about how good the Apple Betty was and when could we go get some more.
This little "Mom & Pop shop" has been in the same location since the 50s - 60s and right now the city of Vista is redoing the street right in front of the shop but don't let that stop you from going, the shop is still accessible. And your reward will be getting some really unique and delicious doughnuts.

data.title: Sooooooo Good! Try apple fritters!
data.text: Danny's has been an institution in Vista for years. They won a big contest for their famous Blueberry Donuts...Need to get there very early to score on of those.  I like the Apple Fritters and Apple donuts.  It's all good.  They used to close around 1 pm but now stay open longer.  Suggest you go in the morning before 11.

data.title: Blueberry donut is the bomb
data.text: It doesn't get any better than the warm blueberry donuts at Danny's.  It is so worth the calories.  Fresh, tasty donuts of all sorts make this place #1 for my donut stop.

data.title: Awesome fresh donuts and more
data.text:
This great Doughnut shop has been around for many, many years, a family owned business that knows how to really make The BEST donuts, apple betty's (apple turnover pastry with cinnamon topping) they are as light as can be and always fresh. They
have won national competitions for their blueberry donuts.  People drive for miles for them. You will LOVE them; guaranteed!!

data.title: Exceeded Expectations
data.text:
Seems like every donut shop buys the same food service supplies and creates the same bland donuts that are not worth eating.
NOT THIS PLACE.

Friends recommended this place to me. They said this place was known for their Blueberry Donuts. I purchased two. Also a apple turnover type donut and a Devil's Food donut. 

These were the best I have ever had. It turns out their Blueberry Donuts have won a national competition. 

So give them a try. You won't be disappointed.
